content:
• Friday, June 6, 2014
  • ERIC

    Neustar -7.2% AH, Ericsson +2.6% on contract e-mail

    • An April 28 e-mail (just made public) from an advisory group suggests Ericsson (NASDAQ:ERIC) is close to winning a major phone number contract currently held by Neustar (NYSE:NSR).
    • The 5-year contract covers the transfer and management of 500M+ phone numbers, and will kick in after the current contract expires on June 30, 2015.  The FCC has the final say on who wins it.
    • Bloomberg observes Neustar has generated $3B+ in revenue from number-switching, which it has exclusively handled since 1997.
    • Ericsson has been trying hard to grow its telecom software/service exposure, and thus cut its dependence on a slower-growing, relatively low-margin mobile infrastructure market.
    • Ericsson bought top telecom billing and provisioning (OSS/BSS) software vendor Telcordia in 2011, and has made complementary acquisitions since. This week, it rolled out an analytics platform for its OSS/BSS solutions.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM | 4 Comments

  • After hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: FDO +5.3%. POZN +3.9%. SPIL +3.7%. CPE +2.5%. MY +2.4%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: NSR -9.1%. NADL -2.7%. CUR -2.4%. ENSV -1.7%. ANFI -1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 4 Comments
  • FDO

    Report: Icahn to push for Family Dollar merger, possibly with DG

    • Charlie Gasparino reports Carl Icahn has told Fox Business he'll push for a Family Dollar (NYSE:FDO) merger, possibly with Dollar General (NYSE:DG).
    • Family Dollar is just two months removed from announcing it'll shut down ~370 underperforming stores following a Feb. quarter that featured a 6.1% revenue drop and a 3.8% same-store sales drop.
    • FDO +9.9% AH. DG +3.3%.
    • Earlier: Icahn discloses 9.39% stake in Family Dollar
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM | 3 Comments
  • FDO

    Family Dollar +9% AH on Icahn stake; peers also up

    • Carl Icahn has disclosed a 10.7M-share (9.39%) stake in Family Dollar (NYSE:FDO).
    • Icahn on Twitter (where else?): "Disclosed a 9% position in FAMILY DOLLAR today. Hope to continue our streak of value enhancement."
    • Rivals are also up: DG +3% AH. DLTR +0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM | 10 Comments
  • PAY

    VeriFone jumps as Street digests FQ2; NCR also up

    • "VeriFone's (PAY +8.6%) new management team is proving to be highly capable operators," gushes Raymond James following the point-of-sale hardware vendor's FQ2 beat and strong top-line guidance.
    • The firm thinks strong demand for VeriFone's MX 900 systems (15 clients bought them) is acting as a catalyst, as are new customer wins and competitive takeaways.
    • The MX 900 series supports EMV technology, which is seeing stronger U.S. interest following Target's huge data breach.
    • Deutsche is a little more cautious on account of margin pressure. Likewise, RBC notes EPS guidance was "somewhat conservative," as VeriFone continues investing heavily.
    • Mentioned on VeriFone's CC (transcript): 1) The company's job cuts/restructuring moves are expected to yield $35M/year in cost savings. 2) Strong Asia-Pac growth (+36% Y/Y) was fueled by Australian hardware demand. 3) 100% of all ad inventory for VeriFone's new taxi advertising platform was sold.
    • Rival NCR (NCR +1.4%) also closed higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: EPI +8.57%. GAZ +5.67%. UNG +3.69%. XHB +2.89%. EWZ +2.86%.
    • Losers: VXX -9.46%. URA -5.19%. TAN -2.33%. TLT -2.20%. TIP -1.56%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • PBR

    Brazilian stocks among today's big winners

    • Petrobras (PBR +7.6%) leads Brazilian stocks higher as support for Pres. Rousseff continues to shrink according to a new opinion poll.
    • Brazil's real rose for a third straight day in the longest stretch of increases in almost a month, as speculation grows that Rousseff will face a runoff after the October election.
    • Other big Brazilian gainers: EDN +7.6%, EBR +6.6%, BBD +4.9%, ITUB +4.2%, CIG +3.6%, VALE +2.7%, BSBR +2%, ELP +1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • ALO

    Timmins Gold denies claim it rebuffed potential buyers

    • Timmins Gold (TGD -9.4%) is denying allegations made by Sentry Investments, which launched a proxy fight against TGD on Monday, that it rebuffed potential buyers that were interested in the company.
    • TGD rejects Sentry's claim that companies with superior growth prospects were denied due diligence access; the miner says one potential suitor made an informal proposal which was brought to the board’s attention and was given due diligence access, while other parties were provided information under confidentiality agreements.
    • TGD also says it tried to resolve its issues with Sentry privately to avoid the proxy contest, and invited the fund manager to propose director candidates.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 5 Comments
  • GMCR

    Late-week break higher from Keurig Green Mountain

    • Keurig Green Mountain (GMCR +3.3%) break higher in afternoon trading to climb back over $116.
    • Shares of GMCR have been swapping hands in a narrow band since Coca-Cola raised its stake in the company to 16%.
    • Today's action is a momentum move not based on news, according to some traders.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM | 5 Comments
  • ARNA

    Arena down as SA author highlights 'multiple red flags'

    • Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -2.4%) is a strong sell on multiple red flags, says SA contributor The Pump Stopper.
    • Among these is the company's failure to disclose an SEC investigation, heavy insider selling, Belviq sales roughly 80% below expectations, and a new formidable competitor OREX awaiting what could be imminent FDA approval of its own product.
    • Price target: $1.25, or about 80% below the current level.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM | 21 Comments
  • PTEN

    Patterson-UTI acquires east Texas pressure pumping operations

    • Patterson-UTI (PTEN +2%) is higher on news of a deal with an unidentified privately-held company to acquire pressure pumping operations in east Texas, including 31.5K horsepower of hydraulic fracturing equipment.
    • PTEN says the purchase provides it with a new base of operations to support drilling programs, supplementing its existing operations in the Permian Basin as well as the Eagle Ford and Barnett shale formations; PTEN also has a significant presence in the Marcellus and Utica shale plays in the eastern U.S.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • GSVC

    Uber raises $1.2B at $17B valuation; GSV Capital rises

    • Uber has raised $1.2B at a whopping $17B pre-money valuation - well above the $10B valuation the app-based taxi service platform was reportedly targeting not too long ago.
    • The funding round makes Uber, which receives a 20% cut on enabled taxi fares, nearly as valuable as LinkedIn, and more valuable than Yahoo after backing out its Alibaba/Yahoo Japan stakes.
    • GSV Capital (GSVC +4.3%), which has invested in Uber rival Lyft and plenty of other late-stage startups, has received a boost from the report. Google invested in Uber last year at a much lower $3.5B valuation.
    • In a Q&A, CEO Travis Kalanick notes Uber is now in 128 cities and nearly 40 countries, and is experimenting with an expansion into logistics services. A courier service called Uber Rush was recently launched in Manhattan.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM | 12 Comments
  • NAV

    Navistar higher after narrowing quarterly loss

    • Navistar (NAV +3.7%) trades higher after posting a smaller FQ2 loss than a year ago on lower warranty expenses.
    • The company's combined Class 8 retail market share rose 100 bps Y/Y and 40 bps Q/Q to 14.9% during the quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • LKM

    NQ Mobile slides; SA author thinks restatement still possible

    • Though the auditors working for NQ Mobile's (NQ -6%) special committee reviewed the company's cash transactions, financial records, and much else, NQ didn't state they reviewed its core revenue recognition practices, writes Ronin Investment Partners.
    • Commenters argue accounting firm PwC (not part of the investigation) is ultimately responsible for studying revenue recognition practices.
    • Ronin still thinks an accounting restatement is possible, and believes anything short of an "unqualified opinion" from NQ's auditors regarding its accounting practices could pressure shares. Back in April, NQ disclosed an accounting revision related to stock compensation expenses.
    • NQ remains up 21% since announcing on Wednesday its special committee's investigation had uncovered no evidence of fraud.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM | 9 Comments
  • RRMS

    Rose Rock target raised at UBS, as truck deal supports investment thesis

    • Rose Rock Midstream (RRMS +3.7%) enjoys strong gains a day after announcing the acquisition of crude oil trucking assets from Chesapeake Energy.
    • UBS maintains its Buy rating on RRMS and raises its price target to $49 from $46; financial terms were not disclosed, but the firm estimates RRMS will pay ~$50M at a ~5.5x multiple, similar to its Barcas trucking acquisition given similar size and location of assets (Briefing.com).
    • UBS says the deal supports its thesis that RRMS will increase distributions at a mid-teens compound annual growth rate over the next three years, driven by organic growth investments and acquisitions.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: RMGN +25%. TIGR +22%. REDF +22%. CMCM +16%. CMTL +17%. OTC:ECTE +13%. ICLD +12%. EFUT +12%. MXC +12%. FCSC +11%.
    • Top 10 Losers: TOPS -36%. RALY -28%. SMSI -17%. END -12%. DMND -11%. SHOS -11%. HTZ -9%. HPTX -9%. TAS -9%. NFEC -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • TRN

    Barron's: Trinity Industries reaping big benefits from shale boom

    • Shares of railcar maker Trinity Industries (TRN +3.3%) have a long way to run, thanks to the U.S. shale boom, busy railways and stricter regulations, Dimitra DeFotis writes in a Barron's profile.
    • Regulators likely will require repair and replacement of old oil tank cars, and replacement is more profitable, but analysts appear too conservative in their earnings estimates for next year, says Sprott Asset Management's John Wilson, pointing to TRN's ~$5B backlog, much of it for rail tankers with strong margins.
    • TRN already has said it would reactivate a large tank-car manufacturing plant in Georgia in anticipation of new regulatory standards, and Sterne Agee's Sal Vitale expects that "will generate large incremental returns."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 8 Comments
  • MWE

    MarkWest Energy sees 2014 fee-based net operating margin over 70%

    • MarkWest Energy (MWE +2.5%) says in a slide presentation at its investor conference that it expects 2014 fee-based net operating margin to exceed 70%.
    • MWE guides 2014 distributable cash flow at $600M-$900M and 7% Y/Y distribution growth in 2015 and 10% in 2016, and says it has completed a significant portion of its 2014 equity financing plan.
    • The company continues to forecast 2014 capex of $2B-$3B.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • SMSI

    Smith Micro -15.1%; company denies Amazon rumors

    • Smith Micro (NASDAQ:SMSI) says it's "not involved in developing a product with Amazon.com, and is not aware of any material undisclosed developments that would account for the unusual trading activity in the Company's stock."
    • Shares flew higher yesterday on a rumor its 3D animation tech would be used in an upcoming Amazon smartphone.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 2 Comments
  • WMC

    Insider buy at Western Asset Mortgage

    • Western Asset (WMC +1.7%) CIO Anup Agarwal makes his first open market purchases of company stock, buying 11K shares this morning at an average of just over $14.43 each.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 4 Comments
  • ITUB

    Brazil soars as support drops for president

    • The Bovespa has its tail in the air to the tune of 2.6% after another dip in support for President Dilma Rousseff to 34% from 37%.
    • Opposition candidates, however, also saw their support drop, bringing the number of voters without a preferred candidate to its highest pre-election percentage in 25 years. Still, the opposition combined is now polling higher than the president
    • EWZ +3.4%, and the banks: ITUB +4.4%, BSBR +1.9%, BBD +4.5%
    • ETFs: EWZ, BRXX, BRAQ, BRZU, BZQ, BRAF, UBR, BRZS, DBBR, FBZ
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 15 Comments
  • SHOS

    Comps weak at Sears Hometown and Outlet Stores

    • Sears Hometown and Outlet Stores (SHOS -9.1%) trades lower after missing estimates with its Q1 report.
    • Comparable-store sales were down 6.2% during the period.
    • Gross margin rate -130 bps to 24.4% due to increased promotional activity.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • UL

    Unilever lower after Credit Suisse warning

    • Unilever (UL -1.8%) trades lower after Credit Suisse issues a report backing its Underperform rating.
    • The investment firm has warned on valuation on Unilever for close to a year. The latest take is that emerging markets won't provide the necessary growth to offset sluggish pricing trends in developing markets.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 6 Comments

  • Mexico central bank unexpectedly cuts rates

    • Surprising 20 economists surveyed by Bloomberg who didn't expect any sort of move, Banco de Mexico slashes its benchmark interest rate by 50 basis points to a record-low 3%.
    • Policy statement
    • The bank two weeks ago had cut its 2014 economic growth forecast to 2.3-3.3% from 3-4% after slower-than-hoped U.S. growth in Q1.
    • EWW +1.3%
    • ETFs: EWW, UMX, SMK, DBMX
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • CMCM

    Cheetah Mobile +14.5% on JPMorgan coverage launch

    • JPMorgan, one of Cheetah Mobile's (NYSE:CMCM) IPO underwriters, has launched coverage with an Overweight and $26 PT.
    • Shares have now fully recovered the big losses they saw following Cheetah's Monday Q1 report. The Chinese app/browser developer is up 32% from its $14 May 8 IPO price.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • ANET

    Arista soars following IPO

    • Arista Networks (NYSE:ANET) opened at $55.25 and is now at $56.59, 31.6% above an elevated $43 IPO price.
    • The fast-growing data center switch vendor has a market cap of $3.61B, or a lofty 10x 2013 sales.
    • Prospectus, IPO analysis
    • Previous coverage
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 5 Comments
  • VTNR

    Vertex Energy -11% after selling 2.2M shares in private placement

    • Vertex Energy (VTNR -11%) says it sold 2.2M common shares at $7.75 each, a 12.3% discount to the 30-day volume-weighted average price, in a private placement to institutional investors.
    • VTNR says it intends to use the proceeds from the offering for its west coast expansion.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • AIG

    42-month high for AIG after boost to buyback

    • AIG (AIG +0.9%) takes out a multi-year high after last night's $2B boost to its share repurchase program. The current price of $55.42 hasn't been seen since the early days of 2011.
    • Barclays chimes in after the news, lifting its price target on the Overweight-rated stock to $64 from $56.
    • Previously: AIG adds $2B to buyback
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 7 Comments
  • ANGI

    Angie's List +8.2% on BofA/Merrill upgrade

    • BofA/Merrill's Paul Bieber has upgraded Angie's List (NASDAQ:ANGI) to Buy, albeit while keeping his $16 PT.
    • Bieber likes what he heard during CEO Bill Oesterie's recent BofA/Merrill conference talk, and thinks the company is seeing a better-than-expected response to its new tiered pricing model.
    • He adds Angie's, dogged recently by growth concerns, is still seeing 20%+ growth in some Midwestern cities, and is once more growing its sales force.
    • 25% of the float was shorted as of May 15. Shares are still down 61% from a 52-week high of $28.32.
    • BofA/Merrill downgraded Angie's on Feb. 5, when shares were at a much loftier price of $18.85.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM | 4 Comments
  • TSL

    Trina +2.8% after pricing offerings

    • Trina (NYSE:TSL) has priced its 8.8M-share stock offering at $11 - 11% below where shares traded when the company first announced the offering on Wednesday.
    • Trina's $150M offering of convertible notes due June 2019 involves an interest rate of 3.5%, and an initial conversion price of $14.30/share - 21% above current levels. Holders are expected to gain the right to require Trina to repurchase the notes in June 2017.
    • Excluding overallotment options, gross proceeds from the offerings are set to total $246.8M.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: REDF +18%. RMGN +11%. MY +10%. GWPH +8%. ANGI +7%. PBR +6%. SIFY +6%. BBD +5%.
    • Losers: TOPS -34%. RALY -23%. HTZ -10%. NVAX -8%. HDSN -6%. ITUB -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • MTN

    Vail Resorts doesn't blame the weather, lift sales +17% in FQ3

    • Shares of Vail Resorts (NYSE:MTN) are higher in early trading after the company sailed past analyst estimates with its FQ3 report.
    • Total skier visits were up 11.2% Y/Y despite a slip at the company's Tahoe resorts.
    • Total lift revenue rose 17.1% to $251.9M.
    • Sales of early passes for the 2014/2015 ski season are up 20% (in dollars) compared to last year.
    • MTN +3.5% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM

  • Futures slightly higher after inline jobs number

    • Stock index futures add a little bit to gains following the inline jobs report, with S&P 500 (SPY) futures +0.2% and Nasdaq 100 (QQQ) + 0.25%. Russell 2000 (IWM) futures are ahead by 0.4%.
    • Treasury yields are bopping around a bit, but the 10-year is unchanged at the moment at 2.57%. TLT +0.2%
    • Gold has added about $1 an ounce since the report, now trading at $1,255. GLD +0.1%
    • Lack of volatility continues in the currency markets, with the dollar (UUP) little-changed against all the majors.
    • Previously: Job gains of 217K, inline with estimates
    • Previously: More on jobs: Participation rate holds steady
     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM | 4 Comments
  • BAC

    BoA slips on $12B+ settlement amount

    • Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) is lower by 0.5% in premarket action after last night's report suggesting the minimum tab for settling over mortgages with the DOJ and several states is $12B, with the final bill likely to surpass JPMorgan's record $13B from last year. For perspective, the bank earned $11.43B in 2013.
    • At least $5B of the settlement is expected to go toward consumer relief - reducing principal amounts, cutting payments, and paying for blight removal in rough neighborhoods.
    • It needs to be noted that the $12B figure is one offered by BofA, but the government is pushing for billions more. While talks have heated up in the past few days, it's still not clear when a deal may be reached.
    • Previously: WSJ: BofA in talks to settle probes for $12B+
     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 AM | 19 Comments
  • HTZ

    Hertz accounting backlash: New costs, spinoff delay, execs to go dark on CC

    • Hertz (NYSE:HTZ) says the widespread accounting problems at the company could delay the planned separation of its equipmental-rental business.
    • Costs tied to the accounting flap are likely to pull Q1 results below consensus estimates.
    • Q1 earnings tallies will be released by Hertz on June 9, but execs with the company will go dark for its planned conference call.
    • SEC Form 8-K
    • HTZ -11.1% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 AM | 6 Comments
  • HTZ

    Restatements possible at Hertz, shares -8.4%

    • Hertz (NYSE:HTZ) says it has determined that at least one material weakness existed in its internal controls over financial reporting.
    • The disclosure is included in a new SEC filing in which the company says financial statements dating back to fiscal year 2011 may need to be adjusted after a "thorough" review.
    • SEC Form 8-K
    • HTZ -8.4% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 AM | 3 Comments
